message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DC 

This paper discusses the Medium Access Controller (MAC) for wireless LANs, which falls under the category of network protocols and architectures. Therefore, cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses security issues, which could fall under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The proposed scheme for enhancing MAC performance involves intelligent collision avoidance, which could fall under cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper discusses performance issues related to packet switching, which could fall under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
